text: is a Japanese city in Aomori Prefecture on the island of Honshu.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Hirosaki," Japan Encyclopedia, p. 319. ==History== Hirosaki was a castle town (城下町) of the Tsugaru clan.Appert, Georges. (1888). Ancien Japon. p. 79. The town grew up around Hirosaki Castle, which was built in 1601. ===City emblem=== Hirosaki uses the swastika (manji ) as official symbol. This came from the flag emblem of the Tsugaru clan in Edo period. ==Geography== Hirosaki is located in the southwest part of Aomori Prefecture. It is in the south of Mount Iwaki; and it is along the border with Akita Prefecture. ==References== ==Other websites== * Hirosaki City website Category:Cities in Aomori Prefecture
title: Hirosaki
